column4: anybody know how to mount a usb stick through terminal??  I lost x and am trying to get files copied before I re-install dapper
the somewhere is the easy part: some dir
use dmesg to figure out what the something is
when using mount, message says that it can't find some dir in fstab or mtab
what mount command did you use?
first, you need 2 tings: something and somewhere
2nd, the things need to be "real":  a real device and a real dir that exists
so first, figure out what the /dev device is that your usb is getting assgned to - it will be something like /dev/sda or sda1 or sg or something... plug it in and run dmesg -
OK, so I know what the USB stick is called (sda1);  how do I mount that so I can copy files to it??
I ran dmsg, and there is quite a  bit of verbage; looks like SCSI device sdb is the one
once I get sdb mounted to dir, then how to copy files to it/
